price_list_2_date: Find the price list date by label "DATE"/"Date" in the header/title. Use the exact format from the document (no normalization) and add it to price_list_2_date.
producer: Take the legal producer name by "Producer"/"Manufacturer" or from the contact block of the company issuing the price list. Keep the full name (and address if shown) in one line. Add to producer.
seller: If the price list explicitly shows "Seller"/"Supplier", extract the full name (and address if any) in one line. If the label is not present, leave empty (do not replace seller with producer). Add to seller.
incoterms: Extract Incoterms (e.g., "CFR SAINT-PETERSBURG, RUSSIA"). Keep the code (EXW/FOB/CFR/CIF/DAP, etc.) and place exactly as printed and add to incoterms.
valid_till: Find validity by label "VALID TILL"/"Valid until". Keep the value (date/period) as-is and add it to valid_till.
HS_code: If the price list shows "HS CODE"/"Tariff code", extract the code(s) in the exact format (e.g., "0304.81"). If multiple, join with "; ". Add to HS_code. If no code, leave empty.
country_of_origin: If "ORIGIN OF GOODS"/"Country of origin" is shown, extract the origin country (e.g., "CHILE") and add to country_of_origin. If missing, leave empty.
products: The "products" block is expandable: create product_1, product_2, ... for each line item in the price list, keeping order. For each position fill all available fields; if a shared attribute (e.g., one Latin species for multiple positions) is given once, duplicate it in the relevant product_i. In token_refs include references to the source fragments (cells/rows) used.
products[*].name_product: Take the commercial name from the "PRODUCT"/"Description" column (e.g., "FROZEN ATLANTIC SALMON FILLET TRIM D VP PREMIUM ..."). Join line breaks while keeping exact spelling. Add to products[i].name_product.
products[*].latin_name: If a Latin species name is shown in parentheses (e.g., "Salmo salar"), extract it and add to products[i].latin_name. If absent, leave empty.
products[*].size_product: Extract size/grade (e.g., "3-4 LB (1.3-1.8 KG)", "80/120"). Keep both systems if both are printed. Add to products[i].size_product.
products[*].unit_box: Record the accounting unit if explicitly shown. Keep the wording as in the document and add to products[i].unit_box.
products[*].packages: If the price list has a packaging column/field ("Packages", "Cartons", "Cases"), extract the quantity and, if present, the type (e.g., "10 CARTONS"). If no such field, leave empty. Add to products[i].packages.
products[*].price_per_KG: Find the unit price in the "Price" column, "Price per KG", etc. Keep the currency and number format (dot/comma) exactly as in the document. Do not compute or change VAT. Add to products[i].price_per_KG.
products[*].total_price: If the price list has a line total (labels like "Total", "Line total", "Ext. price"), extract it with currency and original number format. If no such column, leave empty (do not compute packages x price_per_unit). Add to products[i].total_price.
